<h3>Introducing the DUPLEX Series bags from Afar &amp
Built for life's adventures, even if it's not the one you planned.

The DUPLEX ASCENT hip pack can be worn around the waist or as a sling. It has a large storage compartment with organizational pockets, a key clip and a front zippered pocket. It converts into a full-size backpack in a matter of seconds, quadrupling in size and carrying capacity. While in backpack mode, you still have access to all the hip pack storage as well.

The DUPLEX ROAM crossbody bag has 2 outside quick access pockets and a large zippered interior storage compartment. The dual-adjustable shoulder strap is padded and has a breathable mesh for comfort.  Access a hidden zipper on the bottom of the bag and transform this bag into a duffle bag in seconds. You now have over 5 times the storage capacity.
Adaptable bags designed for everyday use and for your weekend adventures.

column2: Away was born in the Pacific Northwest. Our surroundings give us the inspiration for the products we make. Like many of you, we are curious, spontaneous and adventurous. We are passionate about designing gear that performs as well as it looks. We set out to create bags that are not only lightweight, minimal and durable, but can also expand and transform into an entirely different bag. We meticulously designed the DUPLEX Series bags to balance both form and function. These are bags that are purposely minimal, but packed with features. Our branding is subtle and our materials are modern and sleek. These bags look great and perform well in the city as well as in the outdoors.  A spontaneous hike, a trip to the store, or an overnighter, the DUPLEX bags will help you expand your horizons.

column1: Pacific North West born. Made for the world.
We’ve spent over a year designing, prototyping &
column2: field testing these bags in order to streamline their aesthetic, function and usability. They are now adventure ready and we can’t wait to share them with you. We are launching this campaign to help fund production of the bags and we are offering you a chance to purchase early and at a discount.

column1: We appreciate your support and look forward to being a part of your journeys for years to come.

column2: >Converting the DUPLEX ASCENT from a hip pack to a backpack is quick and easy.

column1: The DUPLEX ASCENT hip pack can be worn around the waist or as a sling. It has a large storage compartment with organizational pockets, a key ring and a front zippered pocket. It converts into a full-size backpack in a matter of seconds, quadrupling in size and carrying capacity. You still have access to all the hip pack storage as well. When converted to a backpack, you can still use the hip pack's waist belt to offload heavier loads, or stash it in the stowaway compartment. Access is easy with 2 large zippered compartments that are separated to keep items organized. It's also useful to keep dirty and clean items separated. A top compartment is accessed by dual zippers and has a divider for a small laptop or tablet. Carry more with two 4-way stretch pockets for water bottles or other items. These pockets feature cinch straps to help keep larger items in place or they are also a great for looping on extra items such as a hat. The front panel is perfect for stashing an extra jacket or it even holds a bike helmet.

column2: >The DUPLEX ASCENT bag converts quickly to hold a ton of gear
>In hip pack mode, you have quick access to organized storage.

column1: The hip pack compartment is ample and provides divided organization when in backpack mode.

column2: >The quick attachment loop is perfect for a bike light.
>The hip pack belt can be neatly tucked away when not in use.

column1: The hip pack belt can be used to help offload weight from your shoulders when in backpack mode.

column2: >Multiple external 4-way stretch pockets for extra carrying capability.
>The large backpack compartment has a divider that can hold up to a 13"" laptop.
>Dual 4-way stretch water bottle pockets with cinch straps hold large and small bottles securely.
>Folds down for packing in a suitcase or storage.
>3D warp-knit air mesh shoulder straps provide comfort and breathability.
>Every detail has been thoughtfully designed and executed.

column1: The DUPLEX ROAM in crossbody mode is compact, but holds all your daily essentials and more.

column3: size_mode=5"" src=""""/>Be spontaneous, the DUPLEX ROAM bag is ready to adapt on the go.

column1: The DUPLEX ROAM crossbody bag has 2 outside quick access pockets and a large zippered interior storage compartment. Inside you'll find a divided pocket and a key clip to keep your keys at the ready. The dual-adjustable shoulder strap is padded and has a breathable mesh for comfort.  Access a hidden zipper on the bottom of the bag and transform the crossbody into a duffle bag in seconds. You now have over 5 times the storage capacity. You can still access the original crossbody storage as well. The shoulder strap can be used in various configurations depending on how you want to carry it. The duffle also has 2 top carry handles and a quick-grab side handle that doubles as a suitcase handle pass through. Carry a water bottle or other items in the 4-way stretch pocket that also features a cinch strap to keep items secure.
This little bag holds all this gear!

column2: >The DUPLEX ROAM bag converts quickly to hold a ton of gear
>A front drop pocket provides quick, secure access.
>The primary crossbody storage compartment can hold larger items such as full-sized headphones.
>A dual zippered top panel gives you access to the main crossbody organized storage.
>A 4-way stretch pocket with a cinch strap keeps water bottles in place.
>The duffle compartment is accessed by a large zippered top opening. You still have access to the crossbody storage for divided organization.
>A zippered side pocket on the duffle provides more storage for items you need quickly.

column1: We use quality, outdoor industry standard materials that are lightweight, yet durable. The outer fabric is water resistant and can be cleaned easily. We use a hi-vis orange material inside the DUPLEX bags so you can find your gear quickly in low light. Our hardware is built to last and our factory has decades of experience building backpacks for some of the best known brands in the world.

""Like many people, in 2020 I lost the job that I loved due to Covid-19 layoffs. I had been working as a product designer in the outdoor industry for a local footwear company. Designing backpacks and other bags was one of my duties and out of all the products I designed, it was what I enjoyed the most. I hated that I had to stop, so I didn't. I kept designing bags hoping that one day I'd find another job and I could bring them to life. At the same time I wanted to spend my new found free time learning a new skill.

I decided in order to become a better bag designer that I should actually learn how to make one myself. I've built furniture, accessories and made ceramics but I never learned to sew. After much trial and error and many hours watching videos about sewing machines and techniques, I finally designed and hand built my first backpack. I took what I learned and decided to take bag making to the next step and Afar &
""A big trend in apparel and bags, especially in the outdoor &
column2: travel industries, is for items to be lightweight and packable. You see a lot of bags that stuff into their own pocket or a pouch. That's great, but then you are just carrying around a bag that you aren't using inside of another bag. My idea for the DUPLEX SERIES bags was that they should still be useful once they are packed down. I started with the idea of making a backpack that could turn into another bag. It had to transform quickly and it had to be lightweight so you aren't carrying around too much extra heavy hardware or fabric. The bag it packs down to had to be highly useful on it's own as well. Once the backpack was solved I added the duffle that turns into a crossbody. I've since designed a whole series of these bags to release in the future.""
>After a year of designing, redesigning, prototyping and field testing, we are now ready to share these bags with you. We can't wait to get the in your hands and we appreciate your support.

column3: Away is based in Portland, OR and was founded by Cole Gerst, a product designer working in the outdoor, apparel and sporting goods industries. While we started with one person's vision, making these bags involves a team of highly creative and talented people to bring them to life. We hope to expand this line and continue to bring you thoughtful, well designed and well crafted products for years to come.

column1: ","Introducing the DUPLEX Series bags from Afar & Away
Built for life's adventures, even if it's not the one you planned.

The DUPLEX ASCENT hip pack can be worn around the waist or as a sling. It has a large storage compartment with organizational pockets, a key clip and a front zippered pocket. It converts into a full-size backpack in a matter of seconds, quadrupling in size and carrying capacity. While in backpack mode, you still have access to all the hip pack storage as well.

The DUPLEX ROAM crossbody bag has 2 outside quick access pockets and a large zippered interior storage compartment. The dual-adjustable shoulder strap is padded and has a breathable mesh for comfort.  Access a hidden zipper on the bottom of the bag and transform this bag into a duffle bag in seconds. You now have over 5 times the storage capacity.
Adaptable bags designed for everyday use and for your weekend adventures.

Afar & Away was born in the Pacific Northwest. Our surroundings give us the inspiration for the products we make. Like many of you, we are curious, spontaneous and adventurous. We are passionate about designing gear that performs as well as it looks. We set out to create bags that are not only lightweight, minimal and durable, but can also expand and transform into an entirely different bag. We meticulously designed the DUPLEX Series bags to balance both form and function. These are bags that are purposely minimal, but packed with features. Our branding is subtle and our materials are modern and sleek. These bags look great and perform well in the city as well as in the outdoors.  A spontaneous hike, a trip to the store, or an overnighter, the DUPLEX bags will help you expand your horizons.
Pacific North West born. Made for the world.

We’ve spent over a year designing, prototyping & field testing these bags in order to streamline their aesthetic, function and usability. They are now adventure ready and we can’t wait to share them with you. We are launching this campaign to help fund production of the bags and we are offering you a chance to purchase early and at a discount.
We appreciate your support and look forward to being a part of your journeys for years to come.
Converting the DUPLEX ASCENT from a hip pack to a backpack is quick and easy.

The DUPLEX ASCENT hip pack can be worn around the waist or as a sling. It has a large storage compartment with organizational pockets, a key ring and a front zippered pocket. It converts into a full-size backpack in a matter of seconds, quadrupling in size and carrying capacity. You still have access to all the hip pack storage as well. When converted to a backpack, you can still use the hip pack's waist belt to offload heavier loads, or stash it in the stowaway compartment. Access is easy with 2 large zippered compartments that are separated to keep items organized. It's also useful to keep dirty and clean items separated. A top compartment is accessed by dual zippers and has a divider for a small laptop or tablet. Carry more with two 4-way stretch pockets for water bottles or other items. These pockets feature cinch straps to help keep larger items in place or they are also a great for looping on extra items such as a hat. The front panel is perfect for stashing an extra jacket or it even holds a bike helmet.
The DUPLEX ASCENT bag converts quickly to hold a ton of gear
In hip pack mode, you have quick access to organized storage.
The hip pack compartment is ample and provides divided organization when in backpack mode.
The quick attachment loop is perfect for a bike light.
The hip pack belt can be neatly tucked away when not in use.
The hip pack belt can be used to help offload weight from your shoulders when in backpack mode.
Multiple external 4-way stretch pockets for extra carrying capability.
The large backpack compartment has a divider that can hold up to a 13"" laptop.
Dual 4-way stretch water bottle pockets with cinch straps hold large and small bottles securely.
Folds down for packing in a suitcase or storage.
3D warp-knit air mesh shoulder straps provide comfort and breathability.
Every detail has been thoughtfully designed and executed.
The DUPLEX ROAM in crossbody mode is compact, but holds all your daily essentials and more.
Be spontaneous, the DUPLEX ROAM bag is ready to adapt on the go.
Adapts with you throughout your day.

The DUPLEX ROAM crossbody bag has 2 outside quick access pockets and a large zippered interior storage compartment. Inside you'll find a divided pocket and a key clip to keep your keys at the ready. The dual-adjustable shoulder strap is padded and has a breathable mesh for comfort.  Access a hidden zipper on the bottom of the bag and transform the crossbody into a duffle bag in seconds. You now have over 5 times the storage capacity. You can still access the original crossbody storage as well. The shoulder strap can be used in various configurations depending on how you want to carry it. The duffle also has 2 top carry handles and a quick-grab side handle that doubles as a suitcase handle pass through. Carry a water bottle or other items in the 4-way stretch pocket that also features a cinch strap to keep items secure.
This little bag holds all this gear!
The DUPLEX ROAM bag converts quickly to hold a ton of gear
A front drop pocket provides quick, secure access.
The primary crossbody storage compartment can hold larger items such as full-sized headphones.
A dual zippered top panel gives you access to the main crossbody organized storage.
A 4-way stretch pocket with a cinch strap keeps water bottles in place.
The duffle compartment is accessed by a large zippered top opening. You still have access to the crossbody storage for divided organization.
A zippered side pocket on the duffle provides more storage for items you need quickly.

We use quality, outdoor industry standard materials that are lightweight, yet durable. The outer fabric is water resistant and can be cleaned easily. We use a hi-vis orange material inside the DUPLEX bags so you can find your gear quickly in low light. Our hardware is built to last and our factory has decades of experience building backpacks for some of the best known brands in the world.
How did this project come about?

Like many people, in 2020 I lost the job that I loved due to Covid-19 layoffs. I had been working as a product designer in the outdoor industry for a local footwear company. Designing backpacks and other bags was one of my duties and out of all the products I designed, it was what I enjoyed the most. I hated that I had to stop, so I didn't. I kept designing bags hoping that one day I'd find another job and I could bring them to life. At the same time I wanted to spend my new found free time learning a new skill.
Learning to sew my first backpack!

I decided in order to become a better bag designer that I should actually learn how to make one myself. I've built furniture, accessories and made ceramics but I never learned to sew. After much trial and error and many hours watching videos about sewing machines and techniques, I finally designed and hand built my first backpack. I took what I learned and decided to take bag making to the next step and Afar & Away was born.""
- Cole Gerst | Designer & Founder | Afar & Away

A big trend in apparel and bags, especially in the outdoor & travel industries, is for items to be lightweight and packable. You see a lot of bags that stuff into their own pocket or a pouch. That's great, but then you are just carrying around a bag that you aren't using inside of another bag. My idea for the DUPLEX SERIES bags was that they should still be useful once they are packed down. I started with the idea of making a backpack that could turn into another bag. It had to transform quickly and it had to be lightweight so you aren't carrying around too much extra heavy hardware or fabric. The bag it packs down to had to be highly useful on it's own as well. Once the backpack was solved I added the duffle that turns into a crossbody. I've since designed a whole series of these bags to release in the future.""
- Cole Gerst | Designer & Founder | Afar & Away
After a year of designing, redesigning, prototyping and field testing, we are now ready to share these bags with you. We can't wait to get the in your hands and we appreciate your support.

Afar & Away is based in Portland, OR and was founded by Cole Gerst, a product designer working in the outdoor, apparel and sporting goods industries. While we started with one person's vision, making these bags involves a team of highly creative and talented people to bring them to life. We hope to expand this line and continue to bring you thoughtful, well designed and well crafted products for years to come.",58.0,0,"1 Campaign

column3:
>A letter to all！

 

 

Dear backers:

 

Here are a few news I’d like to share with all you guys.

 

1. Our official website is up and running. https://www.flamecubes.com

I’m sorry, we’re a little behind. The site is now in the Beta stage, if you find the error please feedback to us, we will provide you site points as a return, points can be used to buy goods on the site.

 

2, As our team promised in # 42 update. A few days ago our team has completed the first donation to environmental organizations.

 

#WWF  https://www.worldwildlife.org/

#IUCN  https://www.iucn.org/

#Greenpeace  https://www.greenpeace.org/

 

(Check #42 update on-- https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/flamecube-th...)

 

A total of 35 PCS FlameCube 2021 was claimed with early bird discount, 35 * 4 = 140, so we donated a total of $140 to WWF, IUCN and Green. This is the first step we’ve taken together.

 

So excited！！！ `(*∩_∩*)′

 

 

Another important piece of news is that our team has decided to officially upgrade environmental protection to the Permanent Mission of the Aishu team, which we call the Earth Care Project. We will donate 0.5%-1% of all sales（Huge share for a startup like us） to environmental groups and volunteers.

For more information about Aishu’s Earth Care program, please click this link.

https://flamecubes.com/earth-care/

 

3. For those of you guys who have supported us, please sign up with https://www.flamecubes.com and we will offer you the points as a thank you!

For example, if you have claimed FlameCube, we will add 1 point to your account for every $1 claimed. If you’ve ever made a contribution to us for none, as we say, we can’t take that for granted, so every dollar you give us will be 10 points on your account at our site.

4，The other good news is that after more than 10 months of planning and preparation, our new product, the FlameCube mini, is coming. If you are interested, please sign up with the https://www.flamecubes.com . We will offer you a super discount of 43% and keep you updated.

 

                                            

 

5. We will provide you with a selection of other outdoor items on our website. If you don’t like them, please keep your points. Because we will continue to update the list of products, there will always be products that deserve your valuable points. （All products are guaranteed for three years warranty）

 

 

 

Hey guys, for real, we are soooo grateful for your company along the way！！

Our team will continue to work hard to bring you more surprises, stay tuned.

In future updates, we’ll keep you posted on our (you guys and Aishu) donations.

 

 

Cheers，

Cui Yu

Co-founder

Aishu team ʕ•ᴥ•ʔ
column4: >The video, text and images below belong to FlameCube 2020（PureFlame）
column6:
showinfo=0"">

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The idea behind FlameCube mini Pro is simple: Using natural resources for fuel such as twigs, pinecones or other biomass found outdoors to build a fire. With this, the thermoelectric generator will turn the heat into electricity! Then use a portion of the electricity to power fans that helps the fire burn cleaner, hotter and keep making electricity.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The FlameCube mini / mini Pro’ size makes it perfect to fit in a bag, in the trunk or even carry. It's literally the size of an apple, and it weighs exactly what you'd expect it to.

 

 


FlameCube mini &
column7:
mini Pro come equipped with 2400mah rechargeable battery. Both can charge your phone even without a live fire. The FlameCube mini Pro can use the thermal energy to re-charge the powerbank. Using an integrated USB port, you can power your USB devices, such as a USB LED light, a phone etc.

 

 

No matter what weather it is, no matter where you go, it will be ready at all times. The waterproof design makes sure that nothing can get into the electronics to ruin your FlameCube mini / mini Pro.

 

 

 1, Easy to set: FlameCube mini/mini Pro is so easy to set up, simply just unfold the collapsible hem, lock in place and pull out the blue control module.

 

 

 2, Touch control：The FlameCube mini/mini Pro offers three different wind speeds for different uses: Grilling, Boiling, Turbo. LED lights on the dashboard shows how much electricity remains.

 

 

 3, Quick Charge：FlameCube mini &
column8:
FlameCube mini Pro both come with the quick charge function, you can charge 80% of battery in 30 minutes, enough to last days.

 

 

 4,Cookwares-sizes adapted: Rotatable pot holders allows it to fit cookwares in different sizes.

 

 

 

Scenario A: For FlameCube mini, when it runs out of battery, you can take down the control module and use it like a regular wood stove. Due to the unique industrial design, FlameCube mini, when it doesn't have a control module, can still have a good performance.
Scenario B: For FlameCube mini, when twigs turn to charcoal, you can take down the control module and turn off the fans to save power and allow the remaining charcoal to burn.
Scenario C: For FlameCube mini/mini Pro, remove the control module to make it easier to clean.

 

 

With two internal jets, FlameCube mini/ mini Pro can release more than 3KW of thermal power when the fire is on. You can boil 1L water within just 4 minutes. 

 

 

 

With FlameCube mini / mini Pro, you can use twigs, pine cones, and other biomass found on the forest floor cooking an entire meal, you never need to buy fuel again.
Due to its unique industrial design, the control module can be kept cool and avoid scalding no matter how long it is used.
It is clean burning, high-efficiency, and fully sustainable without lugging fuel and the inherent risks of petrochemical use and minimizes your footprint.
And most importantly, you won't get your hands dirty.

 

 

Each FlameCube mini/ mini Pro contains a touch control LED light,a charging cable, and a scouring pad.

 

 

Scouring pad: Use for cleaning and wrap the FlameCube mini/mini Pro in your backpack. 

 

Touch control LED light:Measuring 17.7 in (45 CM) in length, touch control, three stage dimming.

 

Charging cable: Blue custommade charging cable. Flat, noodles like structure can ensure that 

the unexpected pull will not easily break or damage cable, meanwhile it is not easy to tie knots.

 

 

 

 

 

Durable stainless steel construction, beautiful design, lightweight to carry and easy to use, we’ve made FlameCube mini / mini Pro a better choice for any outdoorfans to get rid of bulky stoves.

 

 

Unique air intake :Inspired by the work of legendary Genius Leonardo Da Vinci. Not only does the FlameCube mini &
column9:
FlameCube mini Pro have a unique and beautiful appearance, and the amazing part is has a 21% increase in intake efficiency.

 

Unique air outtake : Use the Simulate tools to analogy the airflow in the combustion chamber, to adjust the air passages to make this stove more efficiency and more powerful without smoke. With the special support design, no matter the twigs enters the combustion chamber at any angle and in any position, it can be supported by those triangular support points, leaving a gap for fresh air to pass through, which can significantly improve combustion efficiency and reduce smoke. And even if the twigs become charcoal, it can still maintain a higher heat output power.
And what's more is FlameCube mini/ mini Pro would be better able to handle the moisture twigs too.

 

 Side damping strip design: Increases friction and makes it easier to pull the control module out.

 

Refuel Notch &
column10:
Hinge structural design：We've designed wood refuel notches for the stove, so you don't have to pick up the pot every time you reload. 
Due to the Hinge structural design, can keep FlameCube mini &
column11:
FlameCube mini Pro simple, strong and lightweight. 

 

 

Protective circuit：A protective circuit in the stove control the jets to protect internal components automatically when the fire is on.The generator converts heat into electricity, store it into the battery built in.

 

<
column13:
> 

Two years of work, hundreds of design proposals, dozens of prototypes, hundreds of times of testing, we've finally made a stove that we're proud to share with you all.
column15:
showinfo=0"" width=""560"">

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

With your support, we can bring FlameCube mini to the outdoors fans worldwide at a reasonable price and your support will help us achieve economies of scale and keep the product cost low.​

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Hi there, my name is Yu Cui, I am the industrial designer of Aishu, the designer of FlameCube  . In 2015, I ventured out on a special journey by bike across the whole of China on my own. Over 9 months I traveled more than 13,000 miles across a majority of what you could describe as noman’s land such as large plateaus, snow land, deserts &
column16:
wilderness. It was really an amazing journey, but since most of the areas I passed were no-man's land, so most of the time I had no means to charge my phone, I couldn't film all those memorable scenes. And sometime there's no more power for navigation, I couldn't even call for help in an emergency. In the meantime, I have to carry a lot of supplies and equipments, makes the journey more difficult.

So in 2016, I started drafting up my plan for FlameCube mini. A lightweight camping stove for any adventurer or outdoor enthusiast like myself. After two years of hard work, our team finally made it a reality. Really hope you like it.

 

 

 

 

 

Note: If not specifically specified, Phone, USB LED Lights， pots and other accessories shown in video and pictures just for demonstrationand only，are not included in any perks.

 

 

 

Our factory is located in Shenzhen which is the biggest manufacturing centers in the whole world. We have our special supply chains, skilled workers and every member of our team has years of manufacture experiences.Our team has done all the necessary preliminary work prior to coming to Indiegogo.

The biggest challenges are:

This is the first time we put a project in crowdfunding, we will try to do our absolute best to minimize the risks, e.g. coordinating international logistics and 3rd party vendors.

Every FlameCube mini/ mini Pro includes two lithium batteries , which make them more difficult to ship. The speed of the shipping may vary with the number of units we deliver to each country.

We have spent a year building a very capable supply chain team. we’re ready for mass production. However, component delays and unexpected shortages may occur. If this happens, we will be sure to try our best to quickly solve the problem and keep you informed.

column1: We are two brothers born and raised in the beautiful state of Maine. We have always had a connection to the lush, mixed-growth forests that blanket Maine's landscapes, and since moving out of state a few years ago we have grown to appreciate the wildness that Maine has to offer even more as it's truly not something you can find anywhere else in the world.

We have been studying environmental science and sustainability for most of our adult lives and we are ready to use our knowledge, experience, and passion to create a one-of-a-kind ""eco lodge"" for people eager to learn the secrets that only the Maine woods can teach. Forgotten Lore will be a place for visitors to connect with nature by living comfortably in off-grid yurts on nearly 20 acres of undeveloped forested land for the duration of their stay, while at the same time serving as a base-camp to explore some of the most popular tourist destinations in the country such as Acadia National Park and the amazing coast of Maine in general.

Although the Maine location will be a guaranteed success, Forgotten Lore will not end here. We will develop Forgotten Lore eco lodges in multiple regions, creating a cross-country network of comfortable off-grid sites for people looking to experience all different types of natural ecosystems: high mountain deserts of the southwest, the mountains and forests of southern Appalachia, the temperate rainforests of the Pacific Northwest, and more.

By helping to fund the creation of Forgotten Lore, you will be helping to initiate an entirely new way of experiencing nature in different parts of the country. Forgotten Lore will be more than a brand...it will be a lifestyle.

Jason has a Bachelor's of science in Environmental Science and a Master's degree in Biology. He currently works as a natural resource specialist in Colorodo focusing on water conservation, but is excited to start the Forgotten Lore Journey!

Matt graduated from the University of Southern Maine in 2019 with a Bachelor's of Science in Environmental Science, and is currently completing his Master's degree in Earth Sciences from the University of Hawaii. He has always wanted to get back to his Maine roots and start a business aimed at preserving Maine's natural beauty and wildlife, and Forgotten Lore presents him with that opportunity.

We are raising $25,000 to launch ""phase 1"" of Forgotten Lore Eco Lodge. We have purchased an approximately 20 acre plot of forested, undeveloped land located just up the coast from Acadia National Park, and during phase 1 of the project we will create everything that is necessary to host the first season of visitors and prove the concept before full expansion.
The money raised for this first phase will be used for the following four categories of expenses:
- Installing an access road and parking area
- Purchasing a large ""community area"" yurt and three smaller yurts to serve as the main            lodging

- Purchasing amenities to make the Forgotten Lore guests as comfortable and enjoyable as possible while remaining ""off grid"" (e.g. solar generators, composting toilets, canoe/kayaks, materials for trail building)
- Developing brand-specific merchandise to use for marketing purposes
The perks of investing in phase 1 of Forgotten Lore?:
What happens if we don't reach our entire goal? We will continue to self-fund, secure alternative investments, get loans, and/or whatever else it will take to make Forgotten Lore a reality!

Forgotten Lore will be the leader in a new branch of tourism which merges aspects of camping, sustainable living, environmental education, and health/wellness, among others. Everyone who stays there will benefit from the unique experience that we will provide, but the benefits go way beyond a few literal happy campers.
The local economies will benefit immensely because we will form partnerships with local businesses to help advertise their products and services to Forgotten Lore guests.
The environment will benefit because we will keep the land at every location as undeveloped as possible by minimizing clearing and utilizing primarily temporary structures
column2: even the yurts will be able to be taken down seasonally and potentially even moved around to minimize impact to the land.

column1: The world in general will benefit from the birth of this new concept within the giant sector of the economy that is tourism. We will even force eco-tourism to become more sustainable and more holistic in order to compete with Forgotten Lore. Travelling as we know it is in the past, Forgotten Lore and fully immersive off-grid living on majestic wild land is the way of the future.

The majority of our project experience is in designing and completing research projects spanning the fields of ecology, water quality management and control, conservation, and sustainability. We both have degrees in environmental science, one of us has a graduate degree in biology and the other will have a graduate degree in Earth Science/environmental science before the full launch of Forgotten Lore. We know how to stick to project timelines, manage budgets, and problem-solve/troubleshoot any obstacles that impede progress. We are ready to transform our thoughts of Forgotten Lore into their physical equivalent, and we welcome any contributions toward this extremely impactful goal.

Making Forgotten Lore a reality is not without risks/hurdles, but no business development ever is. We are firm believers in the idea that every problem has a solution and we welcome new challenges as evidence that we are making progress. Below are some examples of risks/hurdles that we have already acknowledged, and more importantly, our plan to overcome them:

Competition- We are not naïve and we fully acknowledge that vacation/tourism industry is well established and there could be some push back from larger organizations that don't want their customers to be drawn toward a different place to stay. However, we actually believe that we can turn this challenge into an advantage. Once Forgotten Lore becomes well-known, there will likely be a wait-list of guests trying to reserve spots for upcoming summer seasons. We will partner with other organizations so that we can recommend other places to stay before/after their stay at Forgotten Lore. Because our anticipated seasonal volume will be so much lower than competitors, there actually is very little (if any) direct competition.

Seasonality- The Gouldsboro location will be somewhat seasonal. The winters in Maine are harsh, and tourism all but dies in the winter months. Ultimately, this is one of the reasons for the plan to expand Forgotten Lore to other regions of the country so that there are locations in every climate for every part of the year. Also, even the Maine location and other locations with less than ideal non summer seasons will be able to cater toward certain sectors of the population, such as winter campers/hikers, snowshoers/cross country skiers, foragers, and schools seeking field trip locations, among others.

Pricing- Forgotten Lore is a novel concept and therefore we are setting the stage for what this type of experience is worth (monetarily). One of our goals is to keep prices reasonable so that people from all different socio-economic groups can reap the rewards that come with a stay at Forgotten Lore. Once we are established we would even like to create programs such as Forgotten Lore scholarship/grant competitions, reduced price/free stays for underprivileged  families, and more.

Changing the game- Again, we are not naïve. Creating a new way for people to experience nature and plan vacations to areas with incredible natural beauty will not be easy. It will require inexhaustible amounts of hard work, planning, and creative energy to educate the masses about what we are creating.
Forgotten Lore is not just a business...it's a way of life. If we don't do it then there's a chance no one will...and that is the biggest risk of them all.

As we already mentioned, one of our challenges is educating the masses about Forgotten Lore. These are difficult times and of course not everyone can contribute financially to our project, but there are many other ways to help!
- Tell your friends, family, everyone about Forgotten Lore!
- Reach out to us on social media or email to give us suggestions, advice, or maybe just words of encouragement!
- As we expand, we will eventually be hiring a team of passionate people to help grow Forgotten Lore to it's full potential, so keep an eye out for job postings
- Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word about Forgotten Lore and other fundraising campaigns!

We are two brothers born and raised in the beautiful state of Maine. We have always had a connection to the lush, mixed-growth forests that blanket Maine's landscapes, and since moving out of state a few years ago we have grown to appreciate the wildness that Maine has to offer even more as it's truly not something you can find anywhere else in the world.

We have been studying environmental science and sustainability for most of our adult lives and we are ready to use our knowledge, experience, and passion to create a one-of-a-kind ""eco lodge"" for people eager to learn the secrets that only the Maine woods can teach. Forgotten Lore will be a place for visitors to connect with nature by living comfortably in off-grid yurts on nearly 20 acres of undeveloped forested land for the duration of their stay, while at the same time serving as a base-camp to explore some of the most popular tourist destinations in the country such as Acadia National Park and the amazing coast of Maine in general.

Although the Maine location will be a guaranteed success, Forgotten Lore will not end here. We will develop Forgotten Lore eco lodges in multiple regions, creating a cross-country network of comfortable off-grid sites for people looking to experience all different types of natural ecosystems: high mountain deserts of the southwest, the mountains and forests of southern Appalachia, the temperate rainforests of the Pacific Northwest, and more.

By helping to fund the creation of Forgotten Lore, you will be helping to initiate an entirely new way of experiencing nature in different parts of the country. Forgotten Lore will be more than a brand...it will be a lifestyle.

Jason has a Bachelor's of science in Environmental Science and a Master's degree in Biology. He currently works as a natural resource specialist in Colorodo focusing on water conservation, but is excited to start the Forgotten Lore Journey!

Matt graduated from the University of Southern Maine in 2019 with a Bachelor's of Science in Environmental Science, and is currently completing his Master's degree in Earth Sciences from the University of Hawaii. He has always wanted to get back to his Maine roots and start a business aimed at preserving Maine's natural beauty and wildlife, and Forgotten Lore presents him with that opportunity.
What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $25,000 to launch ""phase 1"" of Forgotten Lore Eco Lodge. - Installing an access road and parking area
- Purchasing a large ""community area"" yurt and three smaller yurts to serve as the main            lodging

- Purchasing amenities to make the Forgotten Lore guests as comfortable and enjoyable as possible while remaining ""off grid"" (e.g. solar generators, composting toilets, canoe/kayaks, materials for trail building)
- Developing brand-specific merchandise to use for marketing purposes
The perks of investing in phase 1 of Forgotten Lore?:
What happens if we don't reach our entire goal? We will continue to self-fund, secure alternative investments, get loans, and/or whatever else it will take to make Forgotten Lore a reality!

Forgotten Lore will be the leader in a new branch of tourism which merges aspects of camping, sustainable living, environmental education, and health/wellness, among others. Everyone who stays there will benefit from the unique experience that we will provide, but the benefits go way beyond a few literal happy campers.
The local economies will benefit immensely because we will form partnerships with local businesses to help advertise their products and services to Forgotten Lore guests.
The environment will benefit because we will keep the land at every location as undeveloped as possible by minimizing clearing and utilizing primarily temporary structures

About Norshire

We are a team of engineers/makers/innovators who strive to make a difference by designing car accessories with a minimalist philosophy. This time around, we present you Norshire Mini, the world’s smallest and most portable tire inflator ever.

 

Already convinced and decided to help us bring it to life? Great. click Back This Project.

Oh what? Not quite yet? Keep scrolling then.

When you think of tire inflator, you probably think of something like these:

Why do they have to be so bulky and hideous? They simply don’t fit in our modern era predominated by aesthetics that Apple products and Tesla cars embodies.

Above designs have a common flaw: a lot of wasted space. Whereas, Norshire Mini is so compact that it measures only 156mm/6in (batteryless version), 208mm/8.2in (battery version) in length and 40mm/1.6in in diameter.

But of course, designers of those tire inflators wouldn’t agree there’s any space wasted in their products because those hallows are critical for their inflators to cool down.

How does Norshire Mini get rid of the heat from a fast spinning motor and the compressed air?  A powerful cooling fun that ventilates 50L of air per minute and aluminum alloy air cylinder with cooling fins.

Now you can just throw your tire inflator, which is Norshire Mini of course, in the glove box, car door compartment or anywhere in the car and hit the road, or throw it in your backpack and bike away with peace of mind.

We didn’t stop at making Norshire Mini compact and portable.

 

SLEEK

Unlike any tire inflator you’ve seen before, Norshire Mini is a sleek and clear shaped cylinder. It is the first tire inflator that got rid of all physical buttons and features a 0.91in, 128*32 resolution OLED display with capacitive touch.

Even when you don't need to inflate your tires, you can connect Norshire Mini to them at any time to gauge the tire pressure. The screen shows your current pressure immediately when connected like the picture shows above.

 

SMART &
column2:
0.01 ACCURACY

The built-in microcomputer manages the whole system meticulously. 

1. It instantly measures the tire pressure when connected to a tire.

2. It automatically stops when it hits the preset tire pressure.

3. It monitors internal temperature real time and regulates the cooling fan accordingly.

4. High/low voltage alerts, over/under pressure alerts, overheating alert, built-in buzzer and flashing display with words.

The microcomputer does a great job in power management too. The stand-by power consumption is less than 1mA, so the device could sit idle for a whole year after a full charge without being over discharged.

 

EASY TO USE

Minimalism isn’t just a design language shown in the exterior design but a philosophy that sips into very corner of our professional life and very detail of our products. Norshire Mini has only 4 touch buttons, one Power key, one Start/Pause key and a pair of +/- keys to set pressure values. It’s so simple that you won’t even need a manual to operate it.

 

POWERFUL

Just because Norshire Mini is small and cool, both figuratively and literally, doesn’t mean it has to compromise in performance. We utilize a top notch high intensity ferromagnet 380 motor that is small in size but fast in operation, 30,000 rpm, and big in power output, 56w to be specific. The whole system produces 18kg of torque, enabling Norshire Mini to produce 12bar/1.2Mpa/174psi of air pressure and pump 10-17 Liters of air per minute.

 

QUIET

All the high manganese steel gears are precisely regulated to realize dynamic equilibrium, and the whole device is very tightly sealed, making it significantly quieter than a regular tire inflator.

 

SAFE

Norshire utilizes high quality lithium iron phosphate battery, which works well under temperature from -20℃ and 75℃/-4℉ and 167℉, is significantly less prone to spontaneous ignition and explosion than other types of battery, has a life of use up to 7 years, and is environment friendly because it contains no heavy metals, rare metals or toxins.

 

DEMONSTRATION

column1:
PEACE OF MIND

High reliability, low maintenance, durable, and guaranteed for life

The product is so simple that there’s barely anything that could go wrong. Don’t be fooled by its pretty looks, it’s tough. Toss it anywhere for however long time, you can still pull it out to inflate. A full charge allows it to sit idle for a whole year. But in the rare case something does go wrong, we got your back.

 

EVOLUTION

 

THREE VERSIONS

To cater the different inflating needs, we created 3 different versions of Norshire Mini, the Battery-less Version, the Battery Version and the Power Version.

1. The Battery-less Version differs from the Battery Version only in that it doesn't have a built-in battery.

2. The Power Version has a built-in battery just like the Battery Version but produces much high pressure than the other 2 versions.

 

REWARDS

We partnered up with Kickbooster to set up this Referral Program, after joining which you'll be able to earn 10% commission for every pledge you help us raise. Don't miss out.

 

CHARGING &
column2:
POWERING

Norshire Mini can be powered and recharged, in the case of the battery version, via a cigarette lighter that comes with or a 5V/2A DC adapter like those we use to charge our cellphones. Of course 5V is not enough to power our device, but we'll include a special charging cable, as shown below, that boasts the voltage to 12V. Please note that the package doesn't include a 5V/2A DC adapter as we figured everybody has already got one, even more than one. This is to save our environment, and some cost too. We thank you for your understanding.

Producing &
column3:
Final Testing

As you can see, 90% of our products are made of metal, which is very heavy in our hands and feels very good. Of course, this is mainly to reduce the vibration, in addition to better heat dissipation. 

The lower left corner of the OLED display shows the temperature of the equipment. You can also use it as a precision thermometer. In another display interface, its accuracy can reach 0.01.

We hope to show you the best inflatable pumps in the world.

RISKS &
column4:
CHALLENGES
 
It is a fairly simple product and it's is already in pilot production. We are confident that with a few minor tweaks and a couple of weeks of bringing up the manufacturing will run smoothly.

>Take Flight With State-of-The-Art Shock Absorption

Say goodbye to bumps in the road with SPLACH's  Ultra-Smooth Hot Hatch E-scooter, the ideal vehicle for city commute and cross country racing.  We prioritize comfort on functional, entertaining rides.  With first-class ultra-smooth suspension system, riding is a joy.   With the flexible freedom SPLACH offers, a compact, convenient solution for the first mile, the last mile, and everything in between. The powerful motor allows speedy acceleration, offering riders the  excitement of racing.  It's your partner not just for weekdays but also for your laid-back weekends.  Balancing comfort and convenience, speed and safety, we are proud to share a revolutionary way of life.

column1: Most electric scooters on the market are uncomfortable to ride, making uneven roads and bumps a pain to ride through.
column2:
>We designed the all terrain SPLACH electric scooters with aviation grade aluminum and a highly flexible front and rear suspension system that can be manually adjusted for maximum comfort according to the individual’s weight and road conditions.

 

 

 



Our custom-designed tires of high grip are wider than standard ones, giving SPLACH an enormous contact in any road conditions for optimum traction. The pneumatic, air-filled tires absorb shock, making the ride smooth and enjoyable. With deep, customized tread, steering the scooter in control is a walkover.
column3:
>Rear tire: 8-inch wide solid tire, front tire: 8.5-inch pneumatic tire .
All terrain: off-road, on sidewalks, and on city streets.
column4:
>SPLACH's high performance motor and braking system provides you with optimum acceleration and control for steep slopes or sudden stops.
High-speed tire rotation
column5: >SPLACH can take you anywhere at 28 mph, helping you fly past vehicles still stuck in traffic and get to your destination with effortless style.  Moreover, it takes you to 37 miles on a single charge.
column6: >Front and rear brakes ensure you the safest stop on a dime.
column7: >Built-in LED security lighting makes you standout with stylish colors in the dark.
column8: >Headlight and undercarriage light act as shining safeguards along your way.
column9: >Lock it in a click and a swipe to unlock.
column10: >Anti-theft alert system prevents your SPLACH from slipping away.
column11: >Double charging ports save time and energy.  Recharge time is halved to  just 3 hours.
column15: >Easy to fold and fit in your car or carry around.
column16:
> It just takes 10 seconds to fold and stow and you're ready to go.  Ready to give it a try?  Let's fly!

 

 

 



 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 


 

 

 

 



 

 

 



 

 

 

 

 



SPLACH has been a remarkable creator of stylish, practical and eco-friendly vehicles, which are ideal substitutes to cars and other means of transport.

We offer premium electric scooters that are cutting-edge and user-friendly. They embody quality, comfort, functionality, and entertainment. SPLACH Ultra-Smooth Hot Hatch E-scooter is comfortable,versatile vehicle combining city and sport use. Commuting to work and hanging out with friends in a race can both be done on just one scooter: SPLACH.

SPLACH was established in Los Angeles and Taiwan by passionate entrepreneurs. Dennis, the CEO of SPLACH, is committed to designing products that fulfill customers' needs. Graduated from USC, he's well familiar with the US market. Born in Taiwan, he precisely maneuvers state-of-the-art technology in producing high-end e-scooters. With his and the whole team's great ambition and devotion, more advanced items are still to come!

The pneumatic, air-filled tires absorb shock, making the ride smooth and enjoyable. With deep, customized tread, steering the scooter in control is a walkover.Rear tire: 8-inch wide solid tire, front tire: 8.5-inch pneumatic tire .All terrain: off-road, on sidewalks, and on city streets.   SPLACH's high performance motor and braking system provides you with optimum acceleration and control for steep slopes or sudden stops.High-speed tire rotation      SPLACH can take you anywhere at 28 mph, helping you fly past vehicles still stuck in traffic and get to your destination with effortless style.  Moreover, it takes you to 37 miles on a single charge.   Front and rear brakes ensure you the safest stop on a dime. Built-in LED security lighting makes you standout with stylish colors in the dark. Headlight and undercarriage light act as shining safeguards along your way. Lock it in a click and a swipe to unlock.   Anti-theft alert system prevents your SPLACH from slipping away.       Double charging ports save time and energy.  Recharge time is halved to  just 3 hours.     Easy to fold and fit in your car or carry around.  It just takes 10 seconds to fold and stow and you're ready to go.  Ready to give it a try?  Let's fly!                       SPLACH has been a remarkable creator of stylish, practical and eco-friendly vehicles, which are ideal substitutes to cars and other means of transport.We offer premium electric scooters that are cutting-edge and user-friendly. They embody quality, comfort, functionality, and entertainment. SPLACH Ultra-Smooth Hot Hatch E-scooter is comfortable,versatile vehicle combining city and sport use. Commuting to work and hanging out with friends in a race can both be done on just one scooter: SPLACH.SPLACH was established in Los Angeles and Taiwan by passionate entrepreneurs. Dennis, the CEO of SPLACH, is committed to designing products that fulfill customers' needs. Graduated from USC, he's well familiar with the US market. Born in Taiwan, he precisely maneuvers state-of-the-art technology in producing high-end e-scooters. With his and the whole team's great ambition and devotion, more advanced items are still to come!  We're not just building a dream, but making it into reality.  The mass production of SPLACH is underway.  With the strict process flow and inspection, customers are sure of receiving a product of highest quality.  Enjoy your new ride with SPLACH and go further to explore more!",50.0,3,"4 Campaigns

","The Park & Diamond helmet is ultra-portable and designed to fit into a custom water bottle-sized case to easily store in your backpack or large handbag, and will pass U.S. CPSC and EU EN-1078 cycling helmet safety standards. ]    * NYC Department of Transportation Study   Co-founder David Hall's sister was riding her bike through the intersection of Park & Diamond when she was the victim of a hit and run accident. She spent the next four months in a coma. While she has since recovered and graduated from college, Dave and Co-founder Jordan Klein quickly learned that Dave's sister was one of 85,000 Americans to suffer a traumatic brain injury from cycling-related accidents that year.So David and Jordan asked: ""How can we make cycling safer?"". After three years of development, the new Park & Diamond helmet will answer this question!   The Park & Diamond helmet will pass all U.S. and E.U regulations to make sure you get the protection you need while riding a bicycle or kick scooter. Adult sizes will be available first.   When a traditional bike helmet bounces, the EPS foam protective material releases the energy back to the users head during impact increasing the total momentum change the wearer experiences. With this greater momentum change, there is a greater likelihood of a head injury.The Park & Diamond Bike Helmet’s patented protective material absorbs and dissipates three times more elastic energy than a traditional bike helmet, which means significantly less energy is being transferred to the head, and making the Park & Diamond Helmet a better bike helmet. CBS Innovation Nation May 2019     Click on the image to earn cash rewards for pledges from your own referral link!  Our helmet is light and easy to carry. You can roll it up in its custom carry case and store in your backpack, messenger bag or handbag.     Make a personal statement with our customizable helmet skins.  Choose your limited edition color and pattern.   The Park & Diamond helmet is breathable and washable, especially important during warm biking months. Want to change your look? The outside skin is easily replaceable.              Select color and size on the Backerkit survey we send to you 10-14 days after your order date    Additional helmet skins available exclusively on Backerkit, when you fill out your order survey. Colors currently available:  Black, Navy, Gray, Tan, Pink & Maroon only.  The Park & Diamond helmet was designed using patented and proprietary protection materials that are significantly more efficient at absorbing and dissipating energy than traditional bike helmets, It folds/rolls-up into a unique cylindrical case, and has washable and interchangeable skins.* The Park & Diamond™  Helmet is designed and engineered to comply with  U.S, Australia/New  Zealand, and European Union cycling safety standards. On delivery, Park & Diamond will comply with U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC),  AS/NZS 2063:2008,  and the EU EN-1078 safety certifications. “Safe as a traditional helmet"" safety claim is based on Park & Diamond's compliance with these regulations.  ""We see a world without life-altering brain injuries and will relentlessly work to create this reality.""""Building more than a brand, a product, or a company, Park & Diamond sees a barrier-free ecosystem of protection for every lifestyle.""A project three years in the making with the support and recognition from engineering and technology communities. We are fully prepared to deliver.     Jordan Klein is CEO/Co-founder of Park & Diamond, Inc. Jordan and his co-founder, David Hall, launched Park & Diamond three years ago as a mission-based company focused on protecting as many cyclist’s heads as possible, while developing accessible and portable products to fit everyone’s personal style.  Jordan was an Application Engineer at Altec working on making their industrial trucks safer. He attended Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University (in Blacksburg, VA), majoring in Engineering Science and Mechanics, Math, and Entrepreneurship and New Venture Growth. Jordan has had a lifetime passion for cars and has always had a great interest in automotive engineering and how to make all vehicles safer.  Jordan is a big VA Tech Hokie fan, enjoys jet skiing and is keenly interested in anything with wheels that goes fast. Jordan Klein is from Chappaqua, NY and currently lives in Brooklyn, NY. David Hall is President/Co-founder of Park & Diamond, Inc., and also co-designer, co-inventor and co-patent holder of the first Park & Diamond ultra-portable bike helmet. He co-founded Park & Diamond as a mission-based company focused on protecting as many cyclist’s heads as possible while developing accessible and portable products to fit everyone’s personal style.  David attended Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University (in Blacksburg, Va), majoring in Mechanical Engineering with a focus in Industrial Design, product design, medical devices, and the role of cost-effective medical care. Prior to co-founding Park & Diamond, David was on the Virginia Tech engineering team Pediatric Medical Device Institute, as inventor/team leader of an initiative to design, manufacture, and implement a comprehensive infant monitoring system for neonatal hospital units.    David is from the Philadelphia area and can find any excuse to tell you how the Philadelphia Flyers are better than the Pittsburgh Penguins. He enjoys traveling, his two most recent trips were Cuba and Hong Kong and has a knack for getting lost. David is a new resident of Brooklyn, NY and is on a mission to find the spiciest food in NYC, as long as he can find his way home. Keith Cutler is Director, Marketing Partnerships and a founding team member. Keith’s extensive career in sports/entertainment, media and product marketing uniquely positions Park & Diamond to develop one-of-a-kind partnerships to help put more safe and ultra-portable helmets onto cyclist’s heads.  Prior to joining Park & Diamond, Cutler ran KCMG Consulting LLC, focused on marketing and business development for sports, entertainment and media partnerships, C-level recruiting and executive coaching and working closely with startup entrepreneurs on team growth and business development. Other career highlights include: CBS Television Stations Digital Media, Sr. VP Business Development

Rainfactory's experienced team & data-driven, battle-tested approach ensure long-term market dominance for eCommerce start-ups.",60.0,1,"1 Campaign

column2: Style Backpack is a minimalist premium-grade everyday backpack and tote bag
column3:
whether it is with formal or casual clothes, it shows your personal charm and unique style. It is a school backpack, a laptop backpack, and a travel backpack. All-weather waterproof, sand-proof, and mud-proof make it also a good companion for outdoor and water sports. There are many unique features that unmatchable by any other everyday backpacks in the market. To be exact, this is a backpack with long-lasting style and may also save a life someday!

 

The simplicity of minimalist design, long-lasting iconic style, uncompromised functionality, superior security features, and multipurpose practicality. 

 

From material to machines, to workers, they are all top-notch. Thanks to the advanced high-frequency welding machines, which fuse each panel to make the backpack completely waterproof and high durability.

 

Regular airtight zippers are hard to pull and inconvenient for everyday use. The MVB backpack's patented design provides a great solution - the dual-level zipper system, where the outer layer zipper is super smooth, so that open and close the backpack is super easy for frequent zip and unzip. The inner zipper is airtight waterproof. Even the strongest rainfall won't get in
column4:
the inner zipper also has a giant carabiner attached so that it's easy to be located and effortless to zip. 

 

The MVB backpack's minimalist design makes it a perfect fit for anyone, anywhere, anytime, and anything. It's an elegant and professional backpack for workdays or business meetings. It is practical as a back-to-school backpack. It includes a padded laptop pouch to make it a great laptop backpack. It feels sporty and active when bringing it together with you for any sports. It's also the best companion for water sports. It feels smart with casual wear too. The best part is that it gives you the bonus security and protection no matter in the air (anti-theft), on the ground (bulletproof), and at the water (waterproof and floating). 

 

There are many waterproof backpacks out there, but none of them are as trustworthy as the MVB backpack
column5: it doesn't just protect your belonging from water damages assume you run under the storm
column6:
it actually floats, even fully loaded.


 

The MVB backpack is airtight and inflatable. When inflated, the complete backpack becomes a gigantic air max cushion backrest, which gives your back a very comfortable experience.

column1: Professional judges recognize excellent design and quality. That's why the MVB Live &
column2: Living Backpack has won numerous awards in Hong Kong (HKSDA), Japan (Life x Design), and Germany (Reddot and Ambiente Solutions).

column1: The MVB backpack has a dual anti-theft design
column2: (1) the easy hidden zipper for more frequent access
column3: or (2) the extra security combination lock during a long flight or in the classroom or conference, where from time to time your backpack may need to be unattended.

column1: The patented zipper design and unibody construction make the MVB backpack able to resist high levels of pressure, reduce air leaking, and anti-bursting.

The MVB backpack feels high-tech and futuristic, and it's the coolest backpack for your favorite laptops. The included laptop pouch can fit a 16"" Macbook Pro, while its front mesh pockets are convenient to store smartphones, wallets, or booklets. The laptop pouch also has a D-ring to hang your keys and the pen holders beneath the mesh pockets for an Apple Pencil and a ballpen.

Both editions of the MVB backpack are available in two sizes, and all of them now include the laptop pouch and accessories pouch free of charge for a limited time. With these pouches, it will be much easier to organize and tidy up your belongings.

 

Whether playing the stand-up paddleboard, surfing, kayaking, or go to the beach swimming, the waterproof and floating ability of the MVB backpack will be the best companion for all kinds of water sports.

 

 

Never worry the backpack gets wet or dirty anymore
column2: the MVB backpack is absolutely waterproof, sand proof, and mudproof. Cleaning has never been so easy
column3:
rinse the backpack inside and outside, and the best part is that you can dry it instantly by wiping it with a dry towel.


 

 

The MVB backpack is made with TPU fabric, which is strictly tested with FDA, REACH, PROP65 to ensure it's toxic-free and eco-friendly. Our TPU fabric is actually medical-grade, which reduces the possibility and skin allergic or other health concerns. The TPU fabric is also biodegradable so that it reduces pollution to our environment. Unlike other general TPU fabric, we specially developed and textured our TPU fabric to make it feel and look like leather, but without genuine leathers' environmental problems. 

 

 

In addition to all the Standard Edition features and floating ability, the MVB Backpack Shield Edition has 32 layers of Kevlar material built-in, which equals the NIJ Level III bulletproof protection level. 

 

 

The cover of the air nozzle is a personalization badge with a precisely debossed MVB Shield logo. The badge is replaceable, and each backpack includes all seven colors.

column1: In July of 2019 Jason Perez and Wesley Long merged their two existing brands to create what is now Instinct Ready Inc. Jason and Wesley are active Emergency Medical Technicians and industry educators, and for over 6 years have been teaching emergency preparedness as well as CPR and First Aid in our local community. Their combined knowledge and experience in emergency response, as well as our robust two hour emergency preparedness curriculum based on FEMA and NOAA guidelines, creates the foundation for the U-PAK Pro.

We have already been incorporated, in business, and delivering products for over a year and a half. We are raising $15,000 to cover product acquisition costs for increased purchasing power to provide higher quality products and services for our customers and community. As COVID19 continues to affect us, the cost of emergency preparedness equipment and supplies steadily increases. As a result, we must increase the price of our entire product line to start 2021.

The U-PAK Pro is a fresh new take on survival kits. It is the survival system meant to be used, not just stored in your closet. Use it to get acquainted with the great outdoors by taking it camping or backpacking. With regular use, you will become familiar with the contents and tools so when a disaster strikes you will be ready!

The U-PAK Pro is stocked with over 200 survival and comfort items to sustain you. In fact we have built it to match the essential categories we teach in our Fundamentals of Disaster Preparedness class.
We have organized all the gear and supplies into a convenient and easy to use storage system to keep everything accessible and ready to go.

Most survival kits give you a piece of tin foil to keep you warm. The U-PAK Pro features the most advanced shelter and warmth solution in any survival system with an actual tent, compact sleeping bag, and sleeping pad.

If you’re in a pinch the nut free and non-GMO food rations will keep you energized, and if your feeling a little culinary creative, the light weight cooking kit has got you covered. Stay hydrated with emergency water, water filters, and an in-line hydration bladder.
No survival system, including ours, can provide your own clothing, but we can give you a dedicated spot for it. So we did. The included storage cube even provides clothing recommendations.

The U-PAK Pro 2021 MSRP will be $449, which is already a big value considering what’s inside. To get all this stuff yourself will cost you nearly $625, even on Amazon. Trust us we've done the math. However, during this launch campaign we are giving you access to incredible discounts that will probably never be repeated. This campaign is the time to buy!
Instinct Ready’s UPAK Pro Survival System was designed to save your life in a disaster, but it's durability and versatility beg for it to be used often throughout the year.
The U-PAK Pro is Survival Built | Adventure Ready but we need your help to equip and keep safe as many lives as possible.

As 2020 has shown us, we all need to be prepared and preparedness starts at home because prepared families create prepared communities. Join our backer community to help us keep families and communities safe and prepared through our products and services.

We have been working for months to minimize your risks. We have already completed design, prototype QA (the bag in our video and pictures), and we have taken delivery of our first 200 bags.  We are now ready to scale on demand based on campaign success with an estimated 45 day turn around from quantity order to delivery from our factory team. So when this campaign closes the last ordered bag should be delivered within a maximum of 60 days.

Hopefully you don't need a survival system because you and your family are fully prepared already.  If so you can still help by sending this link to your friends and family that aren't prepared. Follow Instinct Ready on our socials and maybe even sign up for a zoom class for you and your loved ones on our website www.instinctready.com.

In July of 2019 Jason Perez and Wesley Long merged their two existing brands to create what is now Instinct Ready Inc. Jason and Wesley are active Emergency Medical Technicians and industry educators, and for over 6 years have been teaching emergency preparedness as well as CPR and First Aid in our local community. Their combined knowledge and experience in emergency response, as well as our robust two hour emergency preparedness curriculum based on FEMA and NOAA guidelines, creates the foundation for the U-PAK Pro.

We have already been incorporated, in business, and delivering products for over a year and a half. We are raising $15,000 to cover product acquisition costs for increased purchasing power to provide higher quality products and services for our customers and community. As COVID19 continues to affect us, the cost of emergency preparedness equipment and supplies steadily increases. As a result, we must increase the price of our entire product line to start 2021.

The U-PAK Pro is a fresh new take on survival kits. It is the survival system meant to be used, not just stored in your closet. Use it to get acquainted with the great outdoors by taking it camping or backpacking. With regular use, you will become familiar with the contents and tools so when a disaster strikes you will be ready!

The U-PAK Pro is stocked with over 200 survival and comfort items to sustain you. In fact we have built it to match the essential categories we teach in our Fundamentals of Disaster Preparedness class.
We have organized all the gear and supplies into a convenient and easy to use storage system to keep everything accessible and ready to go.

Most survival kits give you a piece of tin foil to keep you warm. The U-PAK Pro features the most advanced shelter and warmth solution in any survival system with an actual tent, compact sleeping bag, and sleeping pad.

If you’re in a pinch the nut free and non-GMO food rations will keep you energized, and if your feeling a little culinary creative, the light weight cooking kit has got you covered. Stay hydrated with emergency water, water filters, and an in-line hydration bladder.
No survival system, including ours, can provide your own clothing, but we can give you a dedicated spot for it. So we did. The included storage cube even provides clothing recommendations.
Crank, Battery, and Solar Weather Radio

The U-PAK Pro 2021 MSRP will be $449, which is already a big value considering what’s inside. To get all this stuff yourself will cost you nearly $625, even on Amazon. Trust us we've done the math. However, during this launch campaign we are giving you access to incredible discounts that will probably never be repeated. This campaign is the time to buy!

Hopefully you don't need a survival system because you and your family are fully prepared already.  If so you can still help by sending this link to your friends and family that aren't prepared. column3:
showinfo=0"">

 

What's the Possum Gearstrap?

The Possum Gearstrap is a simple solution for keeping camping, hiking, and hunting gear from sitting on the wet ground in puddles and amongst the critters during your camping, hiking, and hunting  adventures. The Possum Gearstrap is an 8-ft. strap that tightly cinches around any 3-7' diameter tree.

With the help of four sturdy metal carabiners, this allows you to securely stow up to 200 lbs. of gear up off the ground. Not only does Possum Gearstrap keep your gear up and away from trouble, it allows you to keep it at the perfect height...whatever that is for you...so you can access your gear more easily.
column5:
showinfo=0"">

 

The Possum Gearstrap also allows you to keep your campsite organized by putting all of your gear right where you want it. For example, our four carabiners allow you to stow your heavy backpack, along with all your cooking utensils, your snack bags, and even your tinder pack. Since Possum Gearstrap is small and weighs only 5 oz. , it doesn't add much weight to your pack, slipping easily into any side pouch or pocket. Just wrap it around any sturdy tree, tighten the buckle, clip on the carabiners and rotate them upside down, then hang your gear. 

 

 

What’s our plan?

Our current plan is to continue to organically grow our social media presence and website traffic through daily posts, influencer and retailer samplings, contest participation, and subscription box inclusion. Then, we'll apply for a critically important Non-Provisional Utility Patent, which will add the kind of documented credibility retailers and larger investors are looking for, and the kind of legal protection we need. 

After that, we'll begin an aggressive Search Engine Optimization (SEO) program to move the Possum Gearstrap name to the top of searches on Google, Yahoo, Bing, and others. Additionally, we'll combine a moderate pay-per-click (PPC) program with ongoing social media ad placements to  help get the name out there. We'll also be participating in trade shows to gain access to outdoor retail buyers at brick and mortar and online stores across the country.

 

Everyone wins when you support our project

As a backer of our Indiegogo project, you'll not only feel a deep sense of satisfaction knowing you've helped us and outdoorsy folks everywhere, but you'll get some great deals and a little swag. Check out the different reward levels in the Perks section of this page.

 

Check us out online and on social

To learn more about Possum Gearstrap, visit www.possumgeartstrap.com,  or check out our Instagram and Facebook pages to see what we're up to each day and what our fans have to say.

column29: >Being a big fan of Iron Man, we got inspired by its sleek outlook and the bright heart at the center.  The streamlined contour presents the modern as well as the wild look. The battery resembles the heart for our long-lasting expedition, empowering the ride all the way.  Riding on SPLACH-STARK is like wearing the suit that Tony Stark has. You’re gonna be given power, speed, and the superhuman capabilities that no one else has.
column30: >SPLACH has been a remarkable creator of stylish, practical, and eco-friendly vehicles which are ideal substitutes to cars and other means of transport.
column31: >We offer premium electric vehicles that are cutting-edge and user-friendly. They embody quality, comfort, functionality and entertainment. SPLACH-STARK is a comfortable,versatile vehicle combining city and sport use. Commuting to work and hanging out with friends in a race can both be done on just one bike: SPLACH-STARK.
column32: >SPLACH was established in Los Angeles and Taiwan by passionate entrepreneurs. Dennis, the CEO of SPLACH, is committed to designing products that fulfill customers' needs. Graduated from USC, he's well familiar with the US market. Born in Taiwan, he precisely maneuvers state-of-the-art technology in producing high-end e-scooters. With his and the whole team's great ambition and devotion, more advanced items are still to come!

column119:

Other than providing convenience to the public, we would also wish to take a step to protect our environment. In 2015, more than 407 million tonnes of plastic were produced, and almost 75% of them has ended up as waste. The massive waste of plastic directly threatened our ecosystem, including animals, land, air and ourselves.
column121:
/>

By bringing our pack with you, you no longer need to carry lots of plastic bags and produce unnecessary waste. It is durable and reusable, and its minimum size can save tons of materials and space during production and transportation. Not only can it reduce the waste of plastic, but also reduce the carbon emission in the manufacturing process.

column2: >For more detail, head over to:
column3:
>https://keramikslu.com/indiegogo-campaign/

Having learned to make pottery in the centre of Ho Chi Minh City in Vietnam and after a fantastic year long learning curve at the Clay Studio in Manchester,

At the end of 2019, I decided the time was right to up sticks and move to Saint Lucia.

Once here, my goal was to do two things

column1: I bought the perfect piece of land, peaceful with sea and Piton views.
column2:
>

I started on my first goal immediately, setting up a temporary studio and I started to create pieces inspired by the island. Then I converted a room into a small temporary shop and announced to everyone that I was here!

 I have customers in the US and St Lucia as well as visitors to the island.

Everything was going brilliantly

Then I began to build.

Quite quickly I realised that I might not be cut out for the building side of my new life. I thought I would understand everything, but I found many things confusing and people took advantage.

Then COVID happened, scuppering my financial aid plan.

So I have decided to crowdfund my studio build, with enough funds to
column4:
>so that mistakes of the past will not be repeated

What I Need &
column5:
What You Get

To complete my studio, I need £25,000. The entire amount will be used to fund the build, my pottery business provides my living expenses.

There are 3 PERKS open to supporters worldwide
column6:

Supporter - $10

Keramik Superfan - $100

  • one large piece of Keramik Saint Lucia pottery
column9:

column10:

MY LATEST POTTERY PIECES
column11:
>PLEASE NOTE

MAX 2 TRAVELLERS (Only one double bedroom)

Independent use of studio dependent on competency assessment

Car Rental for drivers aged 25 and over

Choice of Dates on a first come, first served basis – Jan to Dec 2022 (COVID willing)
column16:
local taxes

My Vision

My vision is to create a pottery community in my local area as well as providing a stunning location for Potters worldwide to enjoy. Long term, I'd like to offer Workshops and retreats for larger groups, with visiting artists and creators, liasing with independent, local accommodation providers.

Drawing on my many years of experience in the education sector, my longer term vision is also  to use the studio as a safe space to mentor troubled young people, as pottery is a fantastic activity to improve mental health.

Risks &
column17:
Challenges

The biggest risk to this project before was my lack of building knowledge and experience. To solve this, if this campaign is successful, I'll be sending out the call for an experienced Project Manager. 

I have thought about what I might be requiring and if you would like more information or if you know someone who might be interested

https://keramikslu.com/wanted-project-manager/

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Honestly, I know we live in challenging times and you may not be able to contribute financially. You can still help by 

Getting the word out - if you know any Potters or anyone who might want to learn in a fantastic environment, share the link to my page.
